description: These beautiful and obscure territories are the lesser known places on the EU's map.
title: 8 obscure places in the European Union
title_page: 8 obscure places in the European Union - Business Insider
text:
Mayotte is a beautiful French archipelago in the Indian Ocean. Charles Platiau/Reuters The European Union is a vast political body that spans across 28 member states an area of around 1,669,808 square miles, and an estimated population of over 510 million citizens.
The main players include Germany, France, and Britain (until Brexit finally takes place), with more recent additions including Croatia, Romania, and other states in eastern Europe.
However, hidden away on the fringes of the EU are islands and overseas territories that the majority of people have probably never heard of, despite belonging to the EU.
Scroll down to discover the most obscure places on the EU map.
